items.title: Senior Frontend Developer
items.content:
The Role


We are looking to add a full-time, Senior Frontend / JavaScript developer to our PropertyFile team to take ownership of the frontend development and help bring our product to the next level. Together with our team of designers, we need your help to continue improving our user facing platform and give our agents and clients a top-class user experience.


You will help us decide which frontend technologies to use and will become the main source of frontend knowledge for the team.


Being a fully remote team, we encourage active collaboration through Slack and video conferencing in Hangouts, including pair programming, show and tell sessions, sprint demos and retrospectives.



About You


You will be excited by the prospect of working within an agile team delivering a constantly evolving, innovative product and will feel equally comfortable working with other developers as well as with designers and product owners.


You are an experienced frontend developer with strong knowledge of JavaScript frameworks, passionate about writing high quality code and not afraid of experimenting with new technologies when needed.


You have a dedicated and private space to enable home working without interruptions, as well as being able to travel to our office in London once a week.


Ideally, you have access to examples of previous work and you are willing for us to approach your previous employers or clients to request testimonials or references.



What you get from us



  • Competitive salary and benefits.

  • Opportunity to work remotely for most of the week with flexible hours. We`re more interested in high quality code and consistency than a regimented 9 to 5.

  • Direct involvement and the ability to influence the project`s future direction. We are a team; everyone`s opinion is important.



What we need from you



  • Extensive experience developing user facing responsive websites using Bootstrap

  • Excellent knowledge of vanilla JavaScript

  • Experience with JS frameworks, preferably Angular

  • Understanding of web accessibility standards

  • Exposure to frontend automated testing

  • Excellent verbal and written communications skills

  • Excellent time management - we won`t keep prodding you with a stick, but still expect deadlines to be met



This will give you bonus points



  • Frontend performance optimisation

  • Experience developing mobile apps

  • Experience with Google Analytics tracking

items.title: Alt & Dot: Front End Developer - Shopify
items.content:
Front End Developer - Shopify

Posted Oct 30

Alt & Dot
Headquarters: Brooklyn, NY
altanddot.workable.com

Hi there! We’re looking for a Front End Shopify Developer to join the Alt & Dot team. Want to watch your code directly impact a merchant’s sales and conversions? Enjoy bringing designs to life with pixel perfect code and carefully crafted liquid snippets? Read on.

About You

You love code. You enjoy transforming ideas into pragmatic code. You take pride in shipping code that is concise, readable, and standards-compliant.

You love great UX. While you spend most of your time developing, you know your work is about more than the code. You keep the user experience in mind with an eye for design and empathy for the end user.

You love learning new things. You’re excited by new technology and love that your work affords the opportunity for continuous learning. You’re always eager to explore a new language or framework, or to pick up a new hobby outside of the office.

You love helping others. You’re an excellent (and patient) communicator, keen to share your knowledge and put your expertise to use to help teammates, clients, and the community at large.


About Alt & Dot

Operating with Canadian politeness, a New York work ethic, and a splash of California fun, we’re  a small remote team crafting Shopify solutions for ecommerce merchants.

Founded in NYC by a Canadian developer and a Californian designer, we believe the client relationship should be about more than just pixels and code. We pride ourselves on partnering with clients to deliver solutions that solve actual problems, create real opportunities, and bring true value to their businesses.

We offer strategy, design, and development services and enjoy collaborative, ongoing relationships with our clients. We grow by helping them grow.

We're excited to work with talented and empathetic people no matter their race, religion, nationality, sex, physical or mental disability, or age. We believe, when we work together with different views, experiences, and ideas, we can do amazing things.

Our team is fully remote and stays in touch primarily via Slack and weekly stands-ups over Zoom.


About the Role

This is a contract-to-hire position, hours are flexible.

Things you’ll do...
  • Empower clients to grow their businesses through thoughtful implementation
  • Develop new ecommerce websites on the Shopify platform
  • Implement new features or help improve UI/UX on existing shops
  • Collaborate with the team to transform requirements into robust solutions
  • Bring mockups and designs to life with pixel perfect implementation
  • Optimize sites for desktop, mobile and various browsers

You’ll succeed with...
  • Native-level English fluency
  • 2+ years experience in Shopify web development
  • Required Expertise: Liquid, HTML, CSS, jQuery, Javascript
  • Preferred Expertise: AJAX, JSON, Ruby on Rails, Node.js
  • Demonstrated ability to transform designs into pixel perfect code
  • An understanding of cross-browser compatibility and responsive design
  • Ability to self-manage with excellent time management and communication skills

You’ll excel with...
  • Knowledge of Git or other version control systems
  • Familiarity with performance optimization and SEO
  • Experience with Shopify API and SDKs


How to Apply

Apply directly via the link below. We’ve included a few questions that we would normally ask at the start of an interview. This helps us get to know you a bit better and expedite the interview process. Be sure to answer each question for your application to be considered. Creativity in your application is both welcome and encouraged. :)

Apply for this position

https://altanddot.workable.com/j/906F8B3228

items.title: Front end Developer
items.content:
OPPORTUNITY


You’ll be a part of an innovative high-tech startup with a passionate and exceptionally talented team, building the front end web application for Dropsource. Our team works agile and truly values individuals over processes. Our approach yields high quality features, but we are not afraid to step out of that methodology when we think it makes sense.


WHAT YOU’LL DO


As a Front-End Developer at Dropsource you will help analyze and develop new features for the front-end of our web application. You will be expected to collaborate with designers, developers and QA to ensure we are efficiently shipping product.


Your responsibilities will include:



  • Implement new features using React JS, HTML, and CSS

  • Write unit tests for newly developed features

  • Refactoring existing code where necessary to keep our codebase up to date and best practice

  • Work with designers to analyze and validate new features before they are built. This will include analyzing UI/UX designs to give feedback on technical feasibility as well as helping to build functional prototypes

  • Engage with QA team to debug and resolve issues

  • Implement analytics to track user actions and behaviors within the product

  • Track metrics for new features deployed to production to ensure they meet performance and usability requirements


REQUIREMENTS AND QUALIFICATIONS


The ideal candidate will meet the following requirements:


Must have:



  • Experience working in an agile team

  • Extensive experience with at least one major JavaScript framework (Angular, React, Ember, etc.)

  • Knowledge of modern HTML, CSS, and JavaScript patterns

  • Experience working with designers, testers and other developers

  • Experience writing JavaScript unit tests

  • Basic knowledge of good UX patterns

  • Solid understanding of data structures

  • Bachelor of Science degree in a STEM field + 3 years of experience building complex applications for the web. Or equivalent experience


Nice to have:



  • Contributions to open source projects

  • Have an online presence (personal website, blog, portfolio, etc.)

  • Experience with React, ES6, Gulp, Webpack, SASS, Mocha

  • Experience working with a server-side technology like Node.js, Scala

  • Experience with CSS animations

  • Familiar with the design philosophy and constraints of mobile platform app development


DROPSOURCE OFFERS


Dropsource is headquartered in downtown Raleigh, NC and offers flexible office hours, telecommuting options, competitive salaries and benefits and equity participation.


DROPSOURCE (QUEUE SOFTWARE INC.) IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER


**US-based candidates only please**

20d

items.title: Senior Front End/ Full Stack Developer
items.content:
About you

If you care about software quality but find testing and QA boring, maybe you are curious whether there might be a better way?
Do you love building new stuff, learning and working with emerging technologies? Working with a team of skilled engineers with the same passion as yours and a desire to build unique and groundbreaking products?
If so, we would like to hear from you.


About us

We are SpotQA's Product Team, building the next generation of test automation software.
We are building the self-driving car technology for the testing world.
Our objective? To develop new technology that uses machine-learning and domain expertise with the aim of performing testing fully autonomously
To help with our mission, we are looking for a Senior Front End Developer (or a full-stack engineer who has a passion for frontend) to join our team. Ideally, the following characteristics resonate with you:
A CODER WITH AN EYE FOR DESIGN - Code and test technical solutions working closely with our UI / UX designer and development teams
A QUALITY AMBASSADOR - You passionately care about applying best practices and adhering to coding, performance and usability standards
A TEAM LEADER - You are self-driven and want to take an active role to help lead frontend directions of SpotQA



REQUIREMENTS

Most importantly, we are looking for can-do attitudes, a passion to learn/grow independently and willingness to delve into problems.
We also have our eyes on a few skills, namely expertise/strong experience in the following:
Strong Javascript (preferably ES6), HTML5 and CSS3 skills
Strong communication skills along with excellent problem solving / analytical skills
Responsive design expertise, and ability to create cross-browser/cross-device friendly solutions
Willing and able to constantly learn and keep up with the latest and greatest development technologies
Following engineering best practices (e.g., use version control, create tests, use IDEs, debuggers and profilers)
MV* frameworks, (e.g., Vue.js, React.js), as well as Flux-based architectures (e.g., VueX, Redux)



BENEFITS

Competitive Salary.
Possibility of working remotely is available.
Personal development by working with a fast growing multinational startup aiming to shape the future of Digital QA.

items.title: QA Engineer
items.content:
QA Engineer
Location : Central London

Who are we

Twickets was created by music fan, Richard Davies, who made the simple observation that real
fans don’t want to rip other fans off. When we have tickets we can no longer use, most of us
don’t want to sell them for a profit. We just don’t want them to go to waste and are really happy
if we can get our money back. So Richard set up Twickets as a service on Twitter, connecting
fans and allowing them to trade with each other at strictly no more than face value.
Today, Twickets is the largest fan-to-fan marketplace for face value tickets and connects fans
via both website and app (iOS and Android) across three continents. Thousands of tickets are
listed every month for gigs, festivals, sports, comedy, theatre and the arts.
We are growing rapidly, and have attracted support from the industry through our event
partners, investors and the media. Our platform and technologies are constantly evolving as we
strive to innovate and expand into new territories.
We allow ticket resale both on a private basis and through integrations with artists, promoters,
ticket agencies, sporting organisations and venues.

Our Tech

Our backend platform is a Java stack, using Spring, CXF, Thrift, Cassandra, RabbitMQ and
Postgresql, all running on AWS. We deliver everything through web services (REST/JSON) to
the frontend system.
Frontends are written in Bootstrap / AngularJS (the main web site), Android & iOS and for
internally facing web applications, Vaadin framework.

The Role

We are looking for keen, self motivated individual to join our development team at Twickets as a
QA. Our product is a web application, its written in Angular.JS (front end) and Java (backend)
and native mobile apps for the two main mobile platforms. We currently do a combination of
testing by hand and automated testing. Each feature is developed and tested in isolation thenretested at the end of the sprint. You will work closely with the product owner throughout to
make sure that you know the stories being developed and help define acceptance criteria, you
will then test each story as soon as is has come out of code review, and complete final product
testing once all stories in the sprint are complete.
When not actively testing new features, you will be working on improving and extending our
automated test suite, implementing new types of test, all helping assure quality of our product.
Essential skills

You should be a good communicator, a team player and always improving your own skills and
those of others around you. You need to be able to quickly get up to speed with technical
concepts. You should also be strong in the following skills:

- Management of the testing process
- Functional Testing
- Exploratory Testing
- Agile Process
- Continuous Integration
- Version control systems, Git
- HTML/CSS/Javascript
- SQL Databases
Other skills and qualifications
A good degree or similar from a well regarded university or commensurate industry experience
would be beneficial. Also, experience with:
- Integration testing
- Testing mobile applications
- Testing Automation frameworks (selenium, protractor)

The Benefits

● You will be enrolled onto a workplace pension scheme
● Central London offices just off Oxford Street
● Free Kitchen with breakfast, fruit, beer fridge and refreshments
● Gig / event tickets
● Opportunity for remote working

items.title: Ben Loop: JavaScript & React Programmer
items.content:
JavaScript & React Programmer

Posted Oct 25

Ben Loop
Headquarters: Ostrava, Czech Republic
https://benloop.com

Who we are

In Ben Loop we are developing custom-made mobile and web applications. We focus on long-term cooperation in projects and we collaborate with clients from around the globe. Besides the Czech Republic, they are from Spain, Germany and USA at the moment.

Our clients include advanced start-ups as well as bigger and well-established companies and their internal start-ups.

  

What will your working day look like

Ben Loop was founded by two freelancers and, perhaps, that’s why we put great emphasis on personal freedom.

You can start when you want in the morning and decide yourself where you’re going to work. We usually work remotely in Ben Loop, but there are certain periods when we gladly go to our office in Ostrava, Czech Republic.

First thing in the morning we have a stand-up via Slack. The stand-up time may vary and is always arranged by mutual agreement. Some prefer starting early, others work better later.

We usually discuss the previous day’s issues as well as tasks for the current day at the stand-up.

Everyone then works on their assignments during the day and any other potential communication is carried on via Basecamp/Github/Slack. Nobody checks anybody as for when and how they work – only the results are important.

During the day and at the end of it, we commit the work in a standard way to Github where another developer always performs Code Review for you after you complete a task.

We usually work in this way for our clients 4 days a week, the fifth day is dedicated to education, open source or other development activities we don’t have time for during the week.

  
Who we are looking for

We are looking for developers for long-term cooperation from Europe who have experience with Javascript & React, enjoy working on frontend and have active open source profile. We don’t mind if you have contributions to another project or you have your own open projects and apps, but visible activity on Github, for at least several past months, is important for us.

Another important thing for us is the ability to learn new things, open-mindedness, a common touch and the ability to deal with problems independently.

  
What we can gradually offer to you

Not just any degree of freedom
Remote work and flexible working hours (please read – you work no more than 8 hours, when you decide, not from sun to sun).

Extra holiday
Everybody in Ben Loop can take as much paid holiday as they want. We consider rest as an inseparable part of work and therefore we don’t prevent anybody from taking time off when it’s needed.

New hardware on a regular basis
Everyone gets a new MacBook and iPhone or an Android phone (of your choice) every two or three years.

A load of other benefits
Everyone in Ben Loop can choose other benefits which suit them best. The standard ones include sport, massage or education benefits, holiday allowance and more.

Apply for this position

To apply for this position please send a short summarization of your work experience to daniel@benloop.com. Please don’t send us a typical CV, nobody will read it. Also open source activity or open projects are required for this positions, so don’t forget to add a link to your Github profile. We accept only the applicants who live in the Europe. Please add “55” at the end of the subject of your email - we will ignore all other emails without it.

items.title: Senior Engineer / Architect ReactJS @ Modus Create
items.content:
Senior Engineer / Architect ReactJS @ Modus Create

2017-10-24 19:17

Description

In this role you will be converting a PHP monolithic app to an API Microservices architecture app using ReactJS, Redux, Node, GraphQL and MySQL.

You are a forward thinking, creative problem solver with a passion for core JavaScript. If you’ve got the chops and want to ditch the cubicle, apply to the best lean startup development team on the planet. At Modus Create you will collaborate with a cross-functional Scrum team to deliver high quality innovative products in short sprint cycles. This contract role may be performed from a remote location and requires a level of effort estimated at 40 hours per week.

You must be willing to support all of business hours of our client located in Central Time Zone of the United States. Preference will be given to candidates closely aligned with this time zone.

Responsibilities

  • Write lots of quality, high performing JavaScript code
  • Architecture and development of the web apps in ReactJS, Redux
  • Collaborate daily with UX, Engineering, QA and DevOps to deliver functionality for a highly visible web app for a leading educational services company
  • Consult to our end client regarding development best practices

Required Skills and Experience

  • Experience delivering high value, heavy UI front-end products
  • Good understanding of front-end MVC architectures
  • Strong experience with ReactJS and Redux
  • Strong Javascript basis and very good understand of the JS core (ES6/7)
  • Strong experience with GraphQL
  • Good understanding of PHP is a strong plus
  • Good understanding of HTML5 and CSS3
  • Experience with at least one of the SCSS compilers: Sass or Less
  • Experience in following Agile/Scrum SDLC
  • Be comfortable communicating in a virtual environment* A consistent, reliable internet connection

Let’s Talk about You

You value outcomes above all else: You have a proven track record shipping great mobile and web products. By understanding the big picture, you articulate strategy and vision with strong written and verbal communication.

You Lead by Doing: You realize that the big picture is worthless without getting your hands dirty in the technical details for strategic and tactical problem solving. You understand the value of situational leadership and can adapt to the needs and strength of your team.

You Love Work, Growth and Learning: You dream of working in a culture that values hard work, continued learning and innovation with a commitment to building amazing products for clients and their end users. You’ll stop learning when you are dead, and until then you desire to gain deeper knowledge in technology and business.

Let’s Talk About Us

Modus Create is a Product Studio offering consulting services and SaaS products for strategic planning, design and execution of web-based and mobile products. We work across multiple industries with Fortune 1000, ISVs, and startups to validate, plan and launch new products. Headquartered in Reston, VA, we are a bootstrapped team that has grown from 2 to 100 people in 26 countries in 6 years, committed to building the best product consulting firm on the planet. We offer a highly collaborative, autonomous and effective working environment. We love and believe in what we do. This is your chance to be part of building something great.

Why Modus Create

  • Competitive compensation
  • Ability to work remotely / telecommute
  • Working side-by-side with thought leaders in emerging tech

Do you have what it takes to join the DC area's most awesome tech company? Let’s start a conversation.

Country

Anywhere*

Location

You must be willing to support all of business hours of our client located in Central Time Zone of the United States. Preference will be given to candidates closely aligned with this time zone.

items.title: IT Business Management (ITBM) Practitioner - ServiceNow - Remote
items.content:
IT Business Management (ITBM) Practitioner
ServiceNow -Remote
Location(s): Remote

ServiceNow is changing the way people work. With a service-orientation toward the activities, tasks and processes that make up day-to-day work life, we help the modern enterprise operate faster and be more scalable than ever before.
We’re disruptive. We work hard but try not to take ourselves too seriously. We are highly adaptable and constantly evolving. We are passionate about our product, and we live for our customers. We have high expectations and a career at ServiceNow means challenging yourself to always be better.
The IT Business Management (ITBM) Practitioner will be responsible for defining, designing, and overseeing the implementation of ITBM solutions for clients.

What you get to do in this role:
Subject Matter Expert on the ITBM Best Practices
Contribute to the thought leadership of the Project and Portfolio Management Communities of Excellence, as an example

Develop and utilize deep platform knowledge and expertise in:
Workflow Configuration
Application UI Configuration
Development of client specific reporting and integration requirements
Be accountable to ensure Practice deliverables to GEO Customer Delivery and customers are complete, consistent, of high quality, on time and deliver benefits
Contribute to the continual improvement of Global Delivery and Practice business processes as well as the maturing of the IT Business Management portfolio, capabilities, expertise, best practices and solutions
Coaching and mentoring of others and responsible for their career development, education and certification commensurate with the requirements of the practice strategy
Domestic and International travel required up to 50%
In order to be successful in this role, we need someone who has:
Bachelor degree in Computer Engineering, Information Systems Management or equivalent technical / business qualification through 5+ experience

Desired certifications include:
ServiceNow Administrator
ITIL v3 Foundation and/or Advanced ITIL Certifications
SCRUM, Agile, and/or Scaled Agile
CAPM or Prince2 Certification
1-3 years of experience in working with Enterprise IT software (e.g. ServiceNow, Salesforce, PeopleSoft)
1-3 years of experience in Java, Java Script and corresponding frameworks, like jQuery, Prototype JS or Angular
1-3 years of experience working within Agile or Scaled Agile frameworks
Solid experience in requirements gathering, including experience in creating process documentation
Strong interpersonal skills, customer centric attitude, ability to deal with cultural diversity
We provide competitive compensation, generous benefits and a professional atmosphere. This is a very collaborative and inclusive work environment where individuals strong on aptitude and attitude will have an opportunity to grow their professional careers through working with some of the most advanced technology and talented developers in the business.

1-3 years of experience in Java, Java Script and corresponding frameworks, like jQuery, Prototype JS or Angular
1-3 years of experience working within Agile or Scaled Agile frameworks
Solid experience in requirements gathering, including experience in creating process documentation
Strong interpersonal skills, customer centric attitude, ability to deal with cultural diversity
We provide competitive compensation, generous benefits and a professional atmosphere. This is a very collaborative and inclusive work environment where individuals strong on aptitude and attitude will have an opportunity to grow their professional careers through working with some of the most advanced technology and talented developers in the business.

items.title: Technical Customer Support - Weekend Shift @ ReCharge
items.content:
Technical Customer Support - Weekend Shift @ ReCharge

2017-10-21 13:26

Description
DESCRIPTION

ReCharge is a fast moving small team making ecommerce payments easy for everyone. We currently empower thousands of online stores to sell their products on a recurring basis. We’re experiencing incredible growth – from our start 18 months ago we have bootstrapped our way to processing millions of dollars per week.

We are looking for a Technical Customer Success Engineer who is resourceful; using troubleshooting and analytical skills to serve our customers via email, chat, and occasional phone calls. You are self driven, with a knack for digging deep into problems. You have a sense of urgency and draw satisfaction from going above and beyond to provide solutions. You'll help to find convergence in what customers need so that we can build the highest value product. We get a lot of applicants, so we encourage you to do something that stands out and help us know why your the perfect fit for ReCharge.

Job Description:

  • Combining technical expertise with customer service to resolve questions and issues
  • Communicate clearly in writing to both technical and non-technical people
  • Document and build new tools to improve support flows
  • Identify patterns, recommend improvements, and filter out unimportant issues
  • Author documentation for our customer-facing Help Center
  • Assist with successful on-boarding of new customers
REQUIREMENTS
  • Covering EST, CST or PST hours (Saturday-Wednesday)
  • Knowledge of HTML, CSS, Javascript (Knowledge of other programming languages a plus)
  • 2+ Years experience in a similar role at another SaaS company
  • Excellent organizational and communication skills
  • Detail oriented. To prove this make sure to add to job application the headline: "I am detail oriented"
  • Excellent customer service skills with a polite, patient, caring, calm and professional demeanor
  • Language requirements: English fluency (written and spoken)
  • Background in the software industry
BENEFITS
  • Competitive salaries
  • Apple equipment
  • Paid time off
  • Much more...

Country

Anywhere*

Location

Covering EST, CST or PST hours (Saturday-Wednesday)

items.title: Senior Front-End Engineer, JavaScript + .NET @ Olo
items.content:
Senior Front-End Engineer, JavaScript + .NET @ Olo

2017-10-21 13:05

Description

Department: Engineering

Location: (Multiple States)

Type: Full Time

At Olo we develop an online food ordering platform used by many of the country’s largest restaurant chains, reaching millions of consumers. We take pride in a neat codebase with automated tests and continuous integration, and encourage constant refactoring. We encourage new ideas and experimentation. No part of the code base is off limits.

Our current technologies include modern versions of Ember, React, TypeScript, ASP.NET MVC, C#, and F#. We also rely on tools such as AWS, GitHub, TeamCity, Octopus Deploy, Sumo Logic, Datadog, and New Relic. We don’t expect you to have experience with everything in this list, and we’ll help you learn what you don’t know!

As a front-end engineer at Olo, you will play a significant and visible role in helping us build one of the most advanced food ordering platforms in the hospitality industry. You will help us shape the digital guest experience for restaurant brands served by Olo. You will contribute to technology selection, architecture and user experience for our front-end applications.

Any engineer may work at Olo’s headquarters in New York City’s Financial District or remotely from anywhere in the U.S. In fact, more than half of our engineering team is remote!

Requirements

  • Experience building user interfaces that put users first and look and feel awesome to use
  • Deep knowledge of ES6/ES2015+ and one or more modern Javascript frameworks, with a preference for React or Ember
  • Demonstrable understanding of the full .NET web stack
  • Leadership experience that spans one or more aspects of technology selection, architecture and design oversight, and mentoring others
  • Superb problem solving skills with an emphasis on pragmatism, quality, and performance
  • Passion for learning new skills and technologies
  • Excellent collaboration skills
  • BS degree in a technical field of study, or equivalent practical experience
  • Working proficiency and communication skills in verbal and written English
  • Legal right to work in the U.S.

About Olo

Olo reaches millions of consumers by powering mobile and online ordering for many of the country’s largest restaurant chains. Mobile ordering and payments is an exciting and active industry full of interesting players and yet still a relatively untapped market ripe for disruption.

We’re quite up-front about the technical challenges our business faces. Running a platform with multiple white-labeled front-ends, that maintains real-time connections into thousands of restaurants’ POS systems, and coordinates complex transactions between these and other third parties (such as payment gateways and gift card providers) is not for the faint of heart!

Olo is located at 26 Broadway in the historic Standard Oil Building, the former home of John D. Rockefeller. We offer great benefits, such as 20 days of Paid Time Off, fully paid health, dental and vision care premiums, stock options, a generous parental leave plan, and perks like FitBits, rotating craft beers on tap in our kitchen, and food events featuring our clients' menu items (now you know why we give out FitBits!). Check out our culture map.

Olo is an equal opportunity employer and diversity is valued at our company. All applicants receive consideration for employment. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender identity, sexual orientation, pregnancy, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Country

United States

items.title: UX/UI Designer - ZevRoss Spatial Analysis - (Ithaca, NY) - FullTime
items.content:
• ZevRoss Spatial Analysis (Ithaca, NY)
  • Fulltime Job

    • UX/UI Designer

    Overview

    If you have a passion for great design and clean practical user interfaces we want to talk with you. We are looking for candidates with UX/UI skills and an artistic sensibility focused on typography, color, scale and composition. A candidate with experience working with data and producing data visualizations would fit in particularly well. The designer would work closely with our senior software engineer and the rest of the team to bring life to data-driven web apps.

    Skills and Experience

    What you will do:

    • Collaborate with the senior software engineer and data scientists to determine required app functionality and initial workflow
    • Create wireframes and mockups to flesh out initial brainstorms
    • Determine site-wide style guides for ensuring consistent design
    • Code and implement design ideas for application front-ends
    • Analyze usage data and traffic patterns

    Required skills:

    • Fluency in best practices for web-based information architecture and design, as well as strong knowledge of usability principles
    • Well-developed illustration, typographic layout, and artistic skills
    • Some professional experience in UI/UX design including design for mobile sites
    • Commanding knowledge of CSS, HTML and Adobe Creative Suite (or open source analogs) and strong working knowledge JavaScript
    • Proven experience in designing responsive websites and applications across desktop and mobile
    • Portfolio of interaction design and visual design
    • Strong drive to tackle coding challenges and come up with solutions
    • Ability to work in a small, fast-paced team setting
    • Excellent communication skills

    Bonus skills that strengthen your application:

    • Experience working with data: this might include web-based data skills such as experience with D3, HighCharts or other tools as well as experience using tools such R, Python or SQL.
    • Experience making interactive maps with tools such as Google Maps, Leaflet, Mapbox, CartoDB (or others)
    • Experience with geographic data, GIS, spatial analysis

    About us

    We are a growing data science shop focused on working with and visualizing data. A significant chunk of our work involves creating rich data-driven and interactive web apps usually with maps and other graphics to help clients tell a story.

    The data science industry has been growing dramatically over the past several years and you’ll have an opportunity to be part of projects that combine modern data analysis and visualization tools in an effort to make sense of data and convey key messages.

    Our office is in heart of downtown Ithaca, NY; a vibrant college town in the Finger Lakes of New York State. Ithaca is consistently listed as a great place to live due to its walkability, lively downtown and proximity to natural features (waterfalls!). For example, Ithaca was ranked:

    • Best college town in America (Business Insider)
    • 2nd Best Small College Town in the US (USA Today)
    • Top 25 Youngest Best Places to Live (CNN Money)
    • Top 10 Great Places to Live (Kiplinger’s Personal Finance)

    Benefits:

    • Competitive salary, commensurate with experience
    • Health and dental benefits
    • Health savings account/flexible savings account
    • Performance-based end of year bonus
    • Paid vacation and additional paid sick/personal time off
    • Paid maternity and paternity leave
    • A commitment to work-life balance

    To apply:

    This position is intended to be full-time and local in Ithaca. We would consider less than full-time and/or remote work but your interest in a part-time/remote position must be included in your cover letter.

    Send application materials to jobs@zevross.com. The subject should be “Application for UX/UI Position”. Questions about the position should also be e-mailed to jobs@zevross.com but the subject should be “Question about UX/UI Position”.

    Your application materials should include:

    A cover letter explaining your experience and reason for wanting this position. Indicate in the cover letter whether you are willing to work full-time in Ithaca, NY. Please include a brief discussion of how you work and what kind of tools you like to use.

    • A resume/CV
    • A list of three references
    • Links to relevant portfolio material, this can include existing websites, materials on GitHub or other materials that can help us evaluate your work.

    How to apply
